intro: Acinodendron marginatum, commonly known as the marginated acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Acinodendron marginatum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
